isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON SUSPENSION SYSTEMS - CLEAN AND INSPECT - ALL SUSPENSIONS

svcprocinfo.para: Inspect the beam to be certain it is not distorted or cracked.

step1.para: Raise each beam end with a jack. Movement of 1/8 inch (3 mm) or more before the axle is raised indicates excessive wear; replace the bronze center bushing.
After removing the bushings, thoroughly inspect the beam bores. If torch under cutting is found from previous maintenance procedures, replace the beam.

caution.para: If torch undercutting is found from previous maintenance procedures, replace the beam. Do not take responsibility for possible road failure by rebushing a defective beam.

svcsubproc.title: Rubber End Bushings
svcsubproc.para: Raise the rubber bushed beam ends to check for movement of the bushing inner metal sleeve.

caution.para: Movement of the inner metal sleeve is due to excessive wear on mating parts which is beyond tolerance range.

svcsubproc.para: Do not attempt to eliminate movement of the metal sleeves by tightening fasteners beyond values found in the TORQUE CHART.
If you detect any movement, do not operate the vehicle. Replace the rubber end bushing and all connecting parts. Refer to BUSHING REPLACEMENT.

note.para: Because rubber bushings are compressed and loaded on the top side, bushings are slightly relieved (gapping) at the bottom side of the ends. These gaps are normal, not an indication to replace bushing ( Figure 26and Figure 27).

step1.para: Inspect the holes in the axle bracket legs. Remove any burrs, or remains of the old adapter. Use a new adapter as a gauge for fit, being certain it enters the holes from the outside of each bracket leg.
Check the dimension between the inside surfaces of the axle bracket, per dimension "A" in Figure 28.

calloutgroup.callout1: A.FOR 5-1/4 INCH (133.35 MM) LONG END BUSHINGS, "A" DIM. TO BE 5.26/5.27 INCH (133.604/133.858 MM)
FOR 5-3/4 INCH (146.05 MM) LONG END BUSHINGS, "A" DIM. TO BE 5.76/5.77 INCH (146.304/146.558 MM)
FOR 6.00 INCH (152.4 MM) LONG END BUSHINGS, "A" DIM. TO BE 6.010/6.020 INCH (152.654/152.908 MM)

svcsubproc.title: Beam Center Cross Tube
svcsubproc.para: Clean the cross tube. Inspect it for cracks or excessive wear 8 to 10 inches (203 to 254 mm) from each end where it enters into the beam center bushings. Check straightness of the cross tube with a straightedge.

If there is any doubt about the integrity of the cross tube, replace it. The cross tube ends can only be checked if the center bushing is removed for replacement, then the tube removed and installed before the new bushing (cap) end is installed, or the beam is removed from the suspension.

svcsubproc.title: Axle Stops
svcsubproc.para: The four axle stops are furnished and installed by International. The location of these stops on the frame limits axle articulation to ensure that driveline action and brake chamber clearance specifications are not exceeded.
Check the tightening torque of the axle-stop-to-frame fasteners. Refer to the value in the TORQUE CHART.

note.para: If the axle stops are peening the top of the axle housing, contact International to advise them of this condition.
